snippet: The four-week average of applications for unemployment benefits fell to its lowest point since before the recession, buoying the markets. The yield on 10-year Treasuries hit a two-year high.
abstract: Stocks post slim gains on evidence of improving job growth, as yield on Treasury's 10-year-not jumps to 3 percent for first time in more than two years.
lead_paragraph: The four-week average of applications for unemployment benefits fell to its lowest point since before the recession, buoying the markets. The yield on 10-year Treasuries hit a two-year high.

headline.main: Jobs Reports Lift Wall St. to Slight Gain
headline.print_headline: Jobs Reports Lift Wall St. to Slight Gain
